channel.title: Players cant wear donor stuff

item.title: Players cant wear donor stuff
item.dc:creator: @ImperiuM ImperiuM
item.description:
@ImperiuM wrote:

client.java:9785: cannot find symbol
symbol : method Write()
location: class client
Write();
^
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

What is about with this error ? I didnt put something new ![br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 12, 2010, 01:21:02 pm[/size][hr]Oh and how i make energy to dont be unlimited anymore ?

Ahh and how i make UP near Prayer to see me the remaining speed [ I put 100% but it will never go 99-98 etc…]

Read full topic

item.title: Players cant wear donor stuff
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Mercifies, post:5, topic:325161”]ImperiuM, please keep your active topics to a maximum of 1. If you have a new question, please edit your old topic to ask the new question.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 11, 2010, 08:17:52 pm[/size][hr][quote author=ImperiuM link=topic=421502.msg3095475#msg3095475 date=1263255024]
How i restrict donor stuff and admins stuff ?

I puted :

if (wearID == 11003 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 11004 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 16002 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 13636 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 11001 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 11000 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR sM("Only donators can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 773 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 6818 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 4068 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 4069 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 4070 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 4071 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false; } if (wearID == 4072 && playerRights < 2){ sM("Only admins can wield this item!"); return false;

But i get 26 errors :

client.java:8516: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11003 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8518: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8520: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11004 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8522: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8524: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 16002 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8526: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8528: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 13636 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8530: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8532: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11001 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8534: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8536: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11000 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8538: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8540: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 773 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8542: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8544: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 6818 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8546: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8548: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4068 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8550: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8552: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4069 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8554: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8556: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4070 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8558: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8560: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4071 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8562: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8564: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4072 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8566: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ 26 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
[/quote]

The reason you got the errors was you were supposed to

if (wearID == 16002 && playerRights <= 1){

That’s the reason just for a heads up in the future but their, explanations are better than what you originally had.[/quote]

This is wrong.

[quote=“imsokool22, post:3, topic:325161”][quote]if(playerRights < 0)
for(int i : Item.modItems)
if(wearID == i) {
sendMessage(“You must be a mod to use this item.”);
return false;
}
if(playerRights < 1)
for(int i : Item.adminItems)
if(wearID == i) {
sendMessage(“You must be an admin to use this item.”);
return false;
}
if(playerRights < 3)
for(int i : Item.ownerItems)
if(wearID == i) {
sendMessage(“You must be a owner to use this item.”);
return false;
}[/quote]
change i to the item id
example
if(playerRights < 0)
for(int i : Item.modItems)
if(wearID == 8002) {
sendMessage(“You must be a mod to use this item.”);
return false;
}
if(playerRights < 1)
for(int i : Item.adminItems)
if(wearID == 1030) {
sendMessage(“You must be an admin to use this item.”);
return false;
}
if(playerRights < 3)
for(int i : Item.ownerItems)
if(wearID == 980) {
sendMessage(“You must be a owner to use this item.”);
return false;
}[/quote]

This is also wrong.

[quote=“John459, post:2, topic:325161”]That way is a waste of space. First, add this to item.java

public static final int[] modItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid }; public static final int[] adminItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid }; public static final int[] ownerItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid };

Then add this to client.java under “public boolean wear”

if(playerRights < 0) for(int i : Item.modItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a mod to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 1) for(int i : Item.adminItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be an admin to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 3) for(int i : Item.ownerItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a owner to use this item."); return false; }[/quote]

This is correct.

wearID == i sends it through an array, which you replace

public static int[] modItems { itemID };

with all your itemID’s, with comma’s separating each one.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:

But i get 26 errors :

client.java:8516: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11003 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8518: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8520: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11004 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8522: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8524: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 16002 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8526: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8528: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 13636 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8530: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8532: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11001 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8534: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8536: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 11000 && playerRights < 1){// DONATOR ^ client.java:8538: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8540: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 773 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8542: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8544: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 6818 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8546: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8548: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4068 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8550: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8552: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4069 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8554: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ client.java:8556: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if (wearID == 4070 && playerRights < 2){ ^ client.java:8558: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ 26 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

The reason you got the errors was you were supposed to

if (wearID == 16002 && playerRights <= 1){

That’s the reason just for a heads up in the future but their, explanations are better than what you originally had.

item.title: Players cant wear donor stuff
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

if(playerRights < 0) for(int i : Item.modItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a mod to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 1) for(int i : Item.adminItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be an admin to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 3) for(int i : Item.ownerItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a owner to use this item."); return false; }
change i to the item id example if(playerRights < 0) for(int i : Item.modItems) if(wearID == 8002) { sendMessage("You must be a mod to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 1) for(int i : Item.adminItems) if(wearID == 1030) { sendMessage("You must be an admin to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 3) for(int i : Item.ownerItems) if(wearID == 980) { sendMessage("You must be a owner to use this item."); return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: Players cant wear donor stuff
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

That way is a waste of space. First, add this to item.java

public static final int[] modItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid }; public static final int[] adminItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid }; public static final int[] ownerItems = { itemid, itemid, itemid };

Then add this to client.java under “public boolean wear”

if(playerRights < 1) for(int i : Item.modItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a mod to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 2) for(int i : Item.adminItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be an admin to use this item."); return false; } if(playerRights < 3) for(int i : Item.ownerItems) if(wearID == i) { sendMessage("You must be a owner to use this item."); return false; }

Read full topic
